Lack of corroboration online: The expert found no online sources or reports to support the claim that the Earth will go dark for six days in December 2020. This lack of evidence undermines the authenticity of the claim.
Absence of reports or observations: The expert states that as of December 16, there have been no reports or observations of utter darkness in any parts of the country. This contradicts the claim and casts doubt on its accuracy.
No statement from NASA: The expert reached out to NASA and received no immediate reply. However, the claim refers to a statement allegedly made by "NASA Director Charles Bolden," who resigned in 2017. A NASA spokesperson confirmed that the agency has not issued any statement supporting the false claim.
Flagged as false news: The expert mentions that the post containing the claim was flagged by Facebook as part of their efforts to combat false news and misinformation. This indicates that the claim has been recognized as inaccurate and unreliable.
